formalpara.title: Figure 2. The GABA nervous system
formalpara.para: (A) Fluorescent micrograph of an adult C. elegans hermaphrodite stained with an antiGABA antiserum. There are 26 neurons that stain for GABA. Anterior is to the right and the right side of the body is shown. Scale bar = 0.10 mm. (B) Schematic drawing of the positions of the 26 GABA-containing neurons. The DD and VD motor neurons innervate the body muscles, the RME neurons innervate the head muscles, AVL and DVB innervate the enteric muscles, and RIS is an interneuron. Reprinted from Schuske et al. (2004), Copyright (2004), with permission from Elsevier.
